required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety & Effectiveness of Nurse Performed Colonoscopies Under Supervision
clinical_study.official_title: Safety & Effectiveness of Nurse Performed Colonoscopies Under Supervision: A Randomized Controlled Study in Asia (NE Study)

oversight_info.authority: Hong Kong: Joint CUHK-NTEC Clinical Research Ethics Committee

brief_summary.textblock: There is no theoretical or practical reason why non-medical personnel such as nurses could not be trained to perform diagnostic colonoscopy with comparable proficiency as medical endoscopists. Nurse endoscopists have been widely accepted in the United Kingdom for the past 15 years as a valuable resource to cope with the increasing demand for endoscopic service, in particular diagnostic colonoscopy for colorectal screening. A pilot study performed in Hong Kong in 2008 has shown that endoscopy nurses can be trained to perform diagnostic endoscopy safely and reliably. This study aims to demonstrate that properly trained nurse endoscopists have a comparable proficiency in performing colonoscopy procedures as their medical counterparts.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

arm_group.description: Colonoscopy performed by nurse endoscopists supervised by senior medical endoscopists
Colonoscopy performed by senior medical endoscopists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Subjects receiving screening colonoscopy
- 2. Age â‰¥ 18
- 3. Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Subjects have undergone colonoscopy in the past 5 years
- 2. Patients with prior colorectal surgery
- 3. Subjects with a personal history of inflammatory bowel disease, colon adenoma or cancer or family history of Familial Adenomatous Polyposis or Familial non-polyposis syndrome
- 4. Pregnant or lactating women
- 5. Lack of consent

facility.name: Combined Endoscopy Unit, Alice Ho Miu Ling Nethersole Hospital
